ngiemboon: Nzyète nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Yěsô Keleto, Míŋ Ssé.
en: The beginning   of the gospel  # 1:1–8 Mt 3:1–12; Lk 3:1–18 of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.  # 1:1 Some mss omit the Son of God,# 1:1 Jn 5:19; Heb 1:2

ngiemboon: E la zye páʼ Ssé la gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne ntsẅìnkʉ̀ we Esáyà ngie:
en: As it is written in Isaiah   the prophet:  # 1:2 Other mss read in the prophets,# 1:2 Lk 16:29

ngiemboon: Engyè nyìŋ kwɔ̌ʼ fó kwòŋotsẅɛ, ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: A voice of one crying out in the wilderness:

ngiemboon: Jÿâŋ gÿo ńnéŋe tà ńkẅɛɛ kwòŋotsẅɛ, ńne sáʼa mbwó láʼ ngie, pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔb, à nuʼu wɔ́b ntse, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b.
en: John came baptizing  ,# 1:4 Lk 7:29; Ac 22:16 in the wilderness  # 1:4 Rv 12:6 and proclaiming a baptism of repentance  # 1:4 Lk 3:3; Ac 13:24; 19:4; 26:20 for the forgiveness  # 1:4 Mt 9:2; Lk 24:47 of sins.  # 1:4 Jn 15:22; Ac 26:18

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅindê ntsèm tà mbɔɔ pie é lɔ́ɔn ńtsẅé Yelúzálèm ntsèm, é lɔ́ɔn ńtóo ńgyá Jÿâŋ, ńtyé mvfò láʼ, ńzẅíŋe menò tepòŋ mɔ́b, á nuʼu wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ntse Juundʉŋ.
en: The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem   were going out to him, and they were baptized by him in the Jordan  # 1:5 Gn 13:10; Ps 114:3; Lk 3:3 River, confessing  # 1:5 Ac 19:18 their sins.  # 1:5 Jn 15:22; Rm 6:23; 1Pt 4:1

ngiemboon: Jÿâŋ lɔ̌ɔn ḿmaʼa nzsǒ gie mé la lɔg menoŋ kamɛɛ ḿbáʼ, ńdɔg ngùb nɔ̀ɔn ńtʉ́me zẅɛ̌ʼ yé. À lɔ̌ɔn ḿpfɛ́ɛ ngǐm, ḿbiŋe ńjÿó ŋwáʼ tsẅɛ.
en: John wore a camel-hair garment with a leather belt around his waist and ate locusts   and wild honey.  # 1:6 Rv 10:9–10

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie: «Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ aa nzèm mèŋ ńne ńtóo, à cʉa wɔ́ɔn, mèŋ fó te kuʼ mbɔɔ léŋwéʼe ssé, ńkyɛ́ʼ menkÿo melɔ̌ɔn mé wɔ́.
en: He proclaimed, “One who is more powerful   than I am is coming after me.  # 1:7 Jn 1:15 I am not worthy  # 1:7 Mt 3:11 to stoop down and untie the strap of his sandals.  # 1:7 Lk 3:16; Ac 13:23–25

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńgẅiin yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ndàʼ lénuʼu gẅí tsɛ̀ɛ ntse. Táʼ, á ké ńgʉa ná yé, mbà à ge tó, é néŋe gẅí pɔ́ mbwó Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a.»
en: I baptize you with   water,  # 1:8 Jn 1:26,31,33; Ac 1:5; 8:36; 11:16 but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”  # 1:8 Jn 1:33

ngiemboon: Á laa na melyɛ̌ʼ amɛ̌, Yěsô leen ńké fó Nǎzalɛd, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa ńtó, ńgyá Jÿâŋ, á nuʼu yé ntse Juundʉŋ.
en: In   those days Jesus came from Nazareth  # 1:9 Mt 2:23; 4:13; 21:11; Lk 1:26; 2:4,39,51; 4:16; Jn 1:45–46 in Galilee  # 1:9 Mt 17:22 and was baptized in the Jordan by John.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne fóo ntse ńkẅɛɛ, ńgyá ncwò tÿǒ lepwó gwóon ńtsɔ́ʼɔ ńtyé, azẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a sẅɛ́ʼ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ kàpʉ̀ŋ la, ńtó ńtyé na yé.
en: As soon as he came up out of the water, he saw the heavens   being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ ngyè fó tÿǒ lepwó ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ɔɔ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, n kwoŋo gú tɛʼ, gù zɔ gÿo ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn kág.»
en: And a voice   came from heaven:  # 1:11 Rv 14:13 “You are my beloved  # 1:11 Lk 20:13; Eph 1:6; Phm 1 Son;  # 1:11 Ps 2:7 with you I am well-pleased.”  # 1:11 Is 42:1

ngiemboon: Azẅìge tóo na Yěsô páʼɔɔn, ńtsó yé, á gʉa lé kwòŋotsẅɛ.
en: Immediately   the Spirit  # 1:12 Jn 1:33 drove  # 1:12 3Jn 10 him into the wilderness.  # 1:12 Mt 3:1; Rv 12:6

ngiemboon: Pâ menɔ̀ɔn mbàʼ zɔ̌ gwɔ́ wó, ńnéŋe néŋe melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ móm lekùɔ, Sátà gwáa ńtóo ńtsóte yé ngie à fʉa nò. Mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé ne ńdíe yé.
en: He was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted   by Satan.  # 1:13 Mt 4:1,10; Ac 13:10 He was with the wild animals,  # 1:13 Rv 6:8 and the angels  # 1:13 Mt 13:49; Ac 5:19; Rv 14:6 were serving him.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwɔ́ tà ńgwoon Jÿâŋ ńnéŋe ndátsǎŋ, Yěsô gʉa né Ngalílîa. À lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é fóo mbwó Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: After   John was arrested,  # 1:14 Mt 3:12; Lk 3:20; 9:7–9; Jn 3:24 Jesus went to Galilee,  # 1:14 Mt 17:22 proclaiming  # 1:14 Mk 13:10 the good news  # 1:14 Other mss add of the kingdom,# 1:14 Or gospel,# 1:14 Mk 1:1 of God:  # 1:14 Rm 15:16; 1Th 2:2,8–9

ngiemboon: «Afʉ̀ʼ áa páʼɔɔn, mbà á kǔʼ tà Ssé ge zye lényɛ Lefùɔ sé. Pi kúbe mà gẅí, ḿbiŋ ńzẅíŋ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔɔn ŋwɛ́.»
en: “The time    is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God   # 1:15 Mt 3:2; 6:33; 12:28; 19:24; 21:31,43; Mk 4:11; 9:1; 10:14; 12:34; 14:25; 15:43 has come   # 1:15 Mk 9:1 near.   # 1:15 Rm 13:11; 1Pt 4:7 Repent   # 1:15 Ac 3:19; 26:20 and believe   # 1:15 Mk 11:24; Jn 3:16; Ac 10:43; Rm 10:9; 1Pt 1:8–10 the good news! ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńne ńgiŋe ngʉ̀ŋe máa ntse gẅie ée Ngalílîa, ńgyá mbàŋa yépʉ́a, á gwɔ́ Símò pɔ́ fɛ̌ we Ndeléyà. Pɔ́ ne ḿmáʼa lekÿo ntse, á nue ayɔ́b fàʼ á laa lémaʼ messó.
en: As   he passed alongside the Sea of Galilee,  # 1:16 Mt 4:18; 15:29; Jn 6:1 he saw Simon  # 1:16 Mt 16:17 and Andrew,  # 1:16 Jn 6:8 Simon’s brother, casting a net into the sea  # 1:16 Mk 7:31  #— #for they were fishermen.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi tó pege zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńgiŋe, n gÿo pi cʉ́ʼʉ faʼa pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.»
en: “Follow me,”    Jesus told them, “and I will make you fish for   # 1:17 Or you to become fishers of,# 1:17 Mt 4:18–19; Lk 5:2 people.”   # 1:17 Mt 4:19

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé mekÿo mɔ́b, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: Immediately they left their nets and followed   him.  # 1:18 Lk 18:28

ngiemboon: Yěsô náʼa ńgiŋ, ńgyá tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a, á Jÿâg pɔ́ fɛ̌ we Jÿâŋ, é gubé Zebende, pɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ ńne ńnyɛte mekÿo mɔ́b.
en: Going on a little farther, he saw James   the son of Zebedee  # 1:19 Jn 21:2 and his brother John  # 1:19 Jn 21:7 in a boat putting their nets in order.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńtóŋo wɔ́b yɔ́b, pɔ́ leen ńnyé tá wɔ́b Zebende pâ ngàŋafàʼ, á tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: Immediately he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ gÿo ńgʉa Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, á gwɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse pà Yúndà, Yěsô gʉa ndá cúʼtè, ńzye lézíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: They   went into Capernaum,  # 1:21 Lk 10:15 and right away he entered the synagogue  # 1:21 Mk 3:1; Jms 2:2 on the Sabbath  # 1:21 Mk 2:23; Lk 13:10 and began to teach.  # 1:21 Mt 28:20; Ac 4:2; 2Tm 4:11

ngiemboon: Aláʼ júʼu shwóŋè yé, ḿbú ḿmɔɔn ye ntí lézíʼi pʉ̀a mmó, mélàʼmie à lɔ̌ɔn těen ńgÿo páʼ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê wɔ́, à lɔ̌ɔn ńzíʼi tà ńzsé mmó gie à gÿo yɛ̌.
en: They were astonished   at his teaching  # 1:22 Mt 7:28; 22:33; Mk 11:18; Lk 4:32; Ac 2:42; 17:19 because he was teaching them as one who had authority, and not like the scribes.

ngiemboon: Á la ne shwóŋe, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ yé ndá ŋwɛ́, mbà tsɔ̌ ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé, á néŋe tà ḿvege vege ńgaʼte ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Just then a man with an unclean   spirit  # 1:23 Lk 11:24 was in their synagogue.  # 1:23 Jms 2:2 He cried out,

ngiemboon: «Yěsô, nyìŋ Nǎzalɛd, pege gẅiin kɔ́? Ɔ̀ ka fɔ̌ɔn ńtó pɔ́ lépyága wég ka? N ne ńzsé gú. Ɔ̀ fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ Míŋ we.»
en: “What do you have to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth?   Have you come to destroy  # 1:24 Jn 6:27 us? I know who you are #— #the Holy  # 1:24 1Co 7:14 One of God! ”  # 1:24 Lk 4:34; Jn 6:69; Eph 4:30

ngiemboon: Yěsô cÿɔ́g yɛ̌ ssé tepòŋ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Láŋte, éfó na nyìŋ wɛ̂ ńkẅɛ!»
en: Jesus rebuked   him saying, “Be silent,   # 1:25 Mt 22:12 and come out of him! ”

ngiemboon: E ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ gwóon ńtɔ́ɔn ngàŋ ńcʉ́ʼʉ yé lê tʉ̀, ńgwaa fó na yé kẅɛ, ńgaʼte tɛʼ.
en: And the unclean spirit threw him into convulsions,   shouted with a loud voice, and came out of him.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm la gyá púʼu, ḿbú ńcÿɔʼ, ésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Yɔɔn áa lêkɔ́? Áa páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ́ nò sẅé gie á gǐŋ ńkẅɛ lá? Tá à te sáʼ la! À gwɔ̌ tà ńdɔgɔ tʉ̀, ńtsẅii nò mbwó messé tepòŋ, pɔ́ júʼu ncwò wé.»
en: They were all amazed,   and so they began to ask  # 1:27 Mk 8:11 each other, “What is this? A new teaching  # 1:27 Mk 11:18; Ac 2:42 with authority!  # 1:27 Other mss read “What is this? What is this new teaching? For with authority,# 1:27 Jd 25 He commands even the unclean  # 1:27 2Co 6:17 spirits,  # 1:27 Lk 11:24 and they obey him.”

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ Yěsô gwóon saa pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa ŋwɛ́ ntsèm.
en: At once the news about him spread throughout the entire vicinity of Galilee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó ndá cúʼtè ńkẅɛ, pâ Jÿâg pɔ́ Jÿâŋ pú ńgwɔ́, ńgʉa né ndá Símò pɔ́ Ndeléyà.
en: As   soon as they left the synagogue,  # 1:29 Jms 2:2 they went into Simon  # 1:29 Mt 16:17 and Andrew’s  # 1:29 Jn 6:8 house  # 1:29 Mk 9:33 with James  # 1:29 Ac 12:2 and John.  # 1:29 Jn 21:7

ngiemboon: Mákẅìʼ Símò la nuŋe, nnɛ́ ne ńkwɔ́ʼɔ yé. Yěsô kúu wó, mé gwóon shwóŋo yé.
en: Simon’s mother-in-law was lying in bed with a fever, and they told him about her at once.

ngiemboon: Á sẅɛʼte nnɛ́ ńtyé lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńkíbe pwó yé, ńgÿo á lu ssé, ennɛ́ záʼa. Á gʉa ńnyɛte shúm ńdɔg ńdye wɔ́b.
en: So he went to her, took her by the hand, and raised her up.   The fever  # 1:31 Lk 4:38 left her,  # 1:31 Other mss add at once and she began to serve  # 1:31 Phm 13 them.  # 1:31 Rm 12:13

ngiemboon: Ncwònzém gÿo ńgwɔ́, tà mbà nèm pyě, epʉ̀a jʉʼó kaa megàŋa guɔ ntsèm, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie tsɔ́ messé tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b, ńdɔg ńtó ńgyá Yěsô.
en: When   evening came, after the sun had set, they brought to him all those who were sick  # 1:32 Lk 5:31 and demon-possessed.  # 1:32 Mt 9:32

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́ la pú ńcúʼte ncwò ndá.
en: The whole town was assembled at the door,

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo meguɔ ntí ntí na pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, é mag, ńgíŋ ńjwoŋ messé tepòŋ, éfóo na pʉ̀a ńkẅɛɛ. À lɔ̌ɔn těen ńzẅíŋe tà tsɔ̌ ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn nò wɔ́, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie aa yé.
en: and he healed   many who were sick with various diseases  # 1:34 Ac 19:12 and drove out  # 1:34 3Jn 10 many demons.  # 1:34 Rv 9:20; 18:2 And he would not permit the demons to speak, because they knew him.  # 1:34 Mk 3:11–12; 5:7

ngiemboon: Njÿó la gÿo ne ńdʉ́a, tà jʉʼ nyé síŋe sǐŋ, Yěsô lu ssé, éfó ndá ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa lé kwòŋotsẅɛ, ńzye lésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: Very   early in the morning, while it was still dark, he got up, went out, and made his way to a deserted place;  # 1:35 Mt 14:13; Mk 6:31–32; Lk 4:42; 9:12; Rv 12:6 and there he was praying.  # 1:35 Mt 5:44; Ac 12:12

ngiemboon: Símò pâ yetsɔ́ ngàŋakwò Yěsô cʉ́ʼ nzèm ńne faʼa yé,
en: Simon   and his companions searched for him,

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Epʉ̀a metsèm ne faʼa gú.»
en: and when they found him they said, “Everyone is looking for you.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Pege gíŋ ńgʉa né tsɔ́ jʉʼ yendyɛ̀ʼɛ, á tsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ meláʼ mie ée menkwɔʼɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn, mèŋ shwóŋo nò Ssé mbɔɔ wó, ńtí nue ée nkẅɛ̌ ndá wɔ́ɔn.»
en: And he said to them, “Let’s go on to the neighboring villages so that I may preach    there too. This is why I have come.”

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn púʼu, ńgwá ńgiŋe jʉʼ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ mendá cúʼtè, éshwóŋo nò Ssé, ńkúu ńjwoŋo messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a.
en: He went into all of Galilee,   preaching in their synagogues  # 1:39 Mk 3:1 and driving out demons.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ ngàŋnkàʼ gÿo ńtó ńkẅíʼte mvfò Yěsô, ésẅíŋte yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ, mbà ɔ̀ kuʼu légÿo n zeŋe.»
en: Then   a man with leprosy  # 1:40 Gk lepros; a term for various skin diseases, also in v. 42; see Lv 13–14,# 1:40 Mt 11:5 came to him and, on his knees,  # 1:40 Other mss omit on his knees,# 1:40 Mt 17:14 begged him, “If you are willing, you can make me clean.”  # 1:40 1Jn 1:7

ngiemboon: Mezìŋe mé kúu Yěsô, á tsege pwó ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «N kwǒŋ púʼu, zeŋe.»
en: Moved with compassion,  ,# 1:41 Lk 15:20 Jesus reached out his hand and touched  # 1:41 Jn 20:17 him. “I am willing,” he told him. “Be made clean.”

ngiemboon: Nkàʼ gwóon ḿmaga na yé, á zeŋe.
en: Immediately the leprosy   left him, and he was made clean.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ngie à gʉa, ńtɔʼɔ yé,
en: Then he sternly warned   him and sent him away  # 1:43 3Jn 10 at once,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pɔ́ɔn lékím tà shwóŋo nyìŋ, táʼ, ké ńgʉa ńnyɛ mbùm jù, mbwó nùŋepwɔʼ, ḿbiŋ ńnáa mmó gie lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê ne ńzɛ́te mbwó nyìŋ gẅie nkàʼ é magá na yé, à cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a metsèm leen ńké ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ zeŋě.»
en: telling him, “See that you say nothing to anyone;    but go and show   # 1:44 Rv 1:1 yourself to the priest,   # 1:44 Ac 4:1 and offer   # 1:44 Heb 5:1; 8:3 what Moses commanded for your cleansing,   # 1:44 Lv 13–14; Heb 1:3 as a testimony   # 1:44 Mk 6:11; 1Tm 2:6 to them.”   # 1:44 Or against them

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á gʉa, ńdeen ńgwá ńdɔgɔ nò ŋwɛ́ ésa jʉʼ. Á gwɔ́ gwɔ́ tà Yěsô te ńgíŋe shʉashʉa, ńkúu tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, ńcʉ́ʼ ńzso pɔ́ mánzsè, á jʉʼ gie epʉ̀a té wó wɔ́. Mé ké ńne fóo meshÿó meshÿó, ńtóo tǒo, ńgyá yé.
en: Yet he went out and began to proclaim   it widely and to spread the news,  # 1:45 Mk 4:14 with the result that Jesus could no longer enter a town openly. But he was out in deserted places, and they came to him from everywhere.
